review: We bought this  device so that we could stream videos from Netflix, which is pretty much what it is supposed to do. Easy enough, right? If only. We have two windows laptops and three android devices (two phones and one tablet). Chrome on windows just stopped seeing the device, out of the blue. Nothing seems to fix it. As for Android, same story: in a completely random way, the device refuses to connect, or drops the connection while you are watching a show. Resetting the device helps with Android, but it's time consuming and a pain in the butt to do every time we want to watch a show. And resetting the device does NOT solve the problem of Chrome on Windows refusing to see it. I have sent my feedback to Google, with no response. Apparently asking that a device works as advertised is too much these days.Moral of the story: it is so not worth the aggravation. Yes, it's cheap, but frankly if I had thrown the money down the toilet it would have been as useful and less time consuming.
